textField:
To provide top class customer care, employees must have the ABC of Customer Service; they must have the right *Attitude*, they must have appropriate *Behaviours* and they must have *Competence*. 
Having the right attitude means seeing the customer as the single most important person that we deal with and realising that meeting their needs is the most important job we carry out every day. A good attitude towards customers means that we deal with them in a way that is *respectful*. It means that we try to give them top *priority*. It means that we will do that little bit extra to ensure they are *satisfied*. 
A good *attitude* can be defined as having a desire to exceed the *needs* and expectations of the customer. A positive attitude to customers includes trying to *help* even if it isn’t their job, put the customer *first*, ask for *feedback* so that improvements can be made. 
Behaviour means the way in which you behave towards your customer. Behaviour is all about how you *act*. Positive behaviours includes being friendly, helpful and *approachable*, being attentive, being polite, being tidy and *presentable*. 
Competence means being *capable* and effective. A competent customer service person is one who is knowledgeable about their area of responsibility and can give *sensible* and informed answers to questions. The key to being competent in your area of work is being properly *trained*.
